docs.abstract: A guest post by Corbyn Hanson Hightower, whose earlier post about dumpster diving to feed her family struck a chord with readers.
docs.snippet: A guest post by Corbyn Hanson Hightower, whose earlier post about dumpster diving to feed her family struck a chord with readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the more memorable posts on Motherlode was Corbyn Hanson Hightower's account of dumpster diving to feed her family. What struck so many of you were not the facts of her life -- losing a six-figure job, running through her savings, supporting her family by cleaning houses and finding food where she could. What most of you talked about was her tone, her spirit, as she described that fall. She had no apologies for her missteps, and she was determined that in spite of her current straits, that she eat well. Is organic food, you wondered, an entitlement? Is it worth slogging through the trash?

headline.main: Registration Begins for 9/11 Health Compensation Fund

docs.abstract: The federal government's September 11th Victim Compensation Fund has begun registering people who believe they were physically harmed by the terrorist attacks and who are seeking financial compensation.
